intro: Achroanthes cilifolia, commonly known as the threadleaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Achroanthes cilifolia is adapted to arid environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
